Clause:

Alteration: Strengthen an obligation, shift responsibility

Source: INVENDA CORP, S-1/A, 8/28/2000 6.   OFFER HIERARCHY SYNCHRONIZATION
a) e-centives is required to align its categorization methodology with Excite@Home's directory structure as closely as possible. The hierarchy should be structured such that categories like Autos and Electronics should ideally reside at the same level, except for instances where categories such as Cameras may need to be sub-categorized under a more specific parent category.

In this revised version, e-centives is given a stronger obligation to align its categorization methodology with Excite@Home's directory structure. This implies that they must make a greater effort to closely match the structure rather than just using similar methodology as in the original clause. Additionally, the phrase "may not be at the same level" has been replaced with "should ideally reside at the same level", implying a stronger recommendation or expectation for the category arrangement, while allowing for exceptions such as Cameras potentially needing to be sub-categorized under a more specific parent category.

original: 7. "Above-the-Fold" shall mean in a position generally viewable by an end-user customer using an Internet browser which has been maximized to full screen on a computer displaying a minimum resolution of 600 x 800 dpi or higher.
ollama_generated:
7. PLACEMENT (a) During the initial term of this Agreement, a conspicuous "Above-the-Fold" link shall be maintained within the Excite@Home Shopping content area, or its replacement, or an equivalently prominent location as determined by Excite@Home, redirecting users to the Co-Branded Application. The specific placement and phrasing of this link shall be jointly agreed upon. "Above-the-Fold" will refer to a position typically visible on a full-screen Internet browser used with a computer displaying a minimum resolution of 600 x 800 dpi or higher, though Excite@Home reserves the right to adjust this placement should any changes in user interface necessitate such action.

original: i)   Ensure that future emails to the Program Member do not contain any Excite@Home branding; and ii)  Ensure that future emails do not direct the Program Member to the Co-Branded Application . original: Source: INVENDA CORP, S-1/A, 8/28/2000 d)  No e-centives branding of any kind will be present on MESP.

Clause:
Revised: In the MESP, no third-party branding or promotional materials related to e-centives, or any likeness thereof, shall appear without prior written consent from INVENDA CORP.

Explanation: The original clause forbids any e-centives branding on the MESP (Mobile Electronic Services Platform). The revised clause allows third-party branding on the MESP but with the condition that such branding must obtain prior written consent from INVENDA CORP, thus shifting some of the responsibility to the party seeking permission. This revision makes the obligation weaker and more flexible compared to the original clause.

original: e)  To prevent multiple appearances of a single offer on one MESP page view, every offer must be tagged to only one e-centives category.
modified: f) For the purpose of avoiding repeated display of a single offer across various MESP page views, it is recommended (rather than required), but not obligatory, that each offer may be assigned to multiple, relevant e-centives categories, at the discretion of the offering party. The system will prioritize the first assigned category for visibility purposes; however, the offering party shall not be held liable for potential overlaps or inconsistencies in categorization.

original: b)   Application Provider will notify Excite@Home within fifteen (15) minutes of any known and verified unscheduled downtime of the Co-Branded Application  and update the status to Excite@Home each and every hour until service is back up. Upon restoration of service, Application Provider shall notify Excite@Home as promptly as practicable.

original: b)   Throughput of all data being served directly to the end user shall be sustained at least 50Kbits/sec as measured by Excite@Home's monitoring stations in at least 80% of all monitored cases.

No guarantees are made for consistent performance beyond this minimum requirement.
